Throughout our nation, law enforcement officers are taking on the opioid epidemic — saving lives, stopping cartels, and getting poison off the streets. Now, it’s time to extend this work beyond our borders. For years, China has played a leading role in this crisis by manufacturing and distributing the precursor chemicals that end up in the opioids killing Americans. 

My amendment, submitted as part of the State Department Reauthorization markup, directs the State Department to join this fight by engaging with foreign governments to prevent and interdict the flow of synthetic drugs and precursor chemicals, especially those originating from China. It’s time to crack down on every piece of this problem.

As a husband and father to a one-year-old, with another on the way, I understand the challenge that many families face in finding safe and accessible diaper changing facilities when they’re on the go. Families deserve these accommodations, but many small businesses may struggle with the costs of materials and installation. Which is why, during National Diaper Need Awareness Week, I’m proud to co-lead the bipartisan Family-Friendly Facilities Tax Credit Act, which offers tax credits to small businesses which install diaper changing facilities. I’ll keep working to reduce costs and eliminate strains for working families one step at a time.

Profoundly disturbed by the assassination of Charlie Kirk — a proud American and a passionate champion for free speech.
